pages.text: I found an effective way of generating charcoal with cheap materials. By compacting wood logs into log piles and enclosing the piles on all sides, if I start to burn one pile and quickly seal it off, ash piles of charcoal will be formed after letting it burn for some time.
Placing tinder on the ground and filling it with logs makes for an easy campfire to cook with.
A quick an easy way to make a fire starter is with some flint and tinder, though it doesn't last too long. However, I also found a bowdrill to be quite effective as well as durable.
